$interpreted: Naya: Thank you for the supplies.
Hyacinthus: No problem. Gotta take care of each other.
Hyacinthus: Also... It's a sort of an apology for what Nigel did to you both the other day...
Naya: Heh, so these aren't really for free, huh.
Naya: ...It's fine, water under the bridge.
Naya: But, I don't get why you're helping that slimeball.
Hyacinthus: You know, he's really not as bad as you think he is...
Naya: Ugh... Why'd we have to run into these guys.
Hyacinthus: Hold on, let's see what they do.
Naya: Hmm, that guy talking to Nigel is acting a little weird.
Hyacinthus: I noticed that too... Quick, let's follow 'em!
Naya: What? I don't have time to follow him, I gotta take these supplies back to Angel...
Hyacinthus: And who's the one who gave you those supplies? You owe me one!
Nigel: Alright, out with it. What do you need to say?
Slums Man: Nigel...
Slums Man: ...Forgive me! I really needed the money!
Hyacinthus: Nigel, watch out!
Nigel: You... Thank you...
Nigel: What the hell was that all about!?
Slums Man: I-I'm sorry... My son is ill and we don't have enough to see the doctor.
Slums Man: A traveling rune sorcerer that just happened to pass by said he could cure my son for cheap...
Hyacinthus: So you decided to rob Nigel?
Slums Man: I'm so sorry, I just don't have enough money... And then I saw him walking by...
Nigel: I've seen enough sorcerers like that. That guy's a complete con artist. He doesn't have any intention of curing your son.
Slums Man: What... No... So my son's going to die?
Nigel: Listen, I'll take care of the money. Just take your son to a proper doctor.
Slums Man: Wha... Really!?
Nigel: Let's pretend this never happened, as long as you swear to never do something like this again. Swear on your son!
Slums Man: I... I swear! Thank you so much, Nigel!
Naya: I'm genuinely surprised... I thought you'd kick him out of the slums for sure.
Nigel: I couldn't do that. The people here are like my family.  Small mistakes like that can be forgiven.
Nigel: Even if you didn't jump in front of his attack, I wouldn't have been hit. So next time, don't be so reckless.
Nigel: How's your injury?
Hyacinthus: Just a scratch, no big deal~
Nigel: You, check to see if Hyacinthus' injury is serious or not.
Naya: What? Do it yourself!
Nigel: You're both female, it's easier that way.
Hyacinthus: Why are you looking at me like that? I never said that I was...
Naya: I-I get it. I'll check her for injuries!
Nigel: If it's serious, drag her to a doctor even if she says no. I'll take care of the money as well.
Naya: Man, he should stop trying to act all cool. If he's concerned, he should show it!
Hyacinthus: Nigel's always been like that. I'm used to it.
Naya: You have a point, though. He's a kinder person than I thought, in his own way.
Naya: How about you? Short hair, rugged speech... If you hadn't told me, I'd have thought you were just a slightly girlish guy.
Hyacinthus: I need to help Nigel take care of the Slums. Acting tough makes things easier.
Naya: ...Sacrificing yourself to protect Nigel... Changing yourself for him...
Naya: ...Are you...?
Hyacinthus: N-No way! It's not like that.
Hyacinthus: I'm just happy to take on some of Nigel's responsibilities, that's all.

Model.Text: Thank you for the supplies.
No problem. Gotta take care of each other.
Also... It's a sort of an apology for what Nigel did to you both the other day...
Heh, so these aren't really for free, huh.
...It's fine, water under the bridge.
But, I don't get why you're helping that slimeball.
You know, he's really not as bad as you think he is...

Nigel...

Just a scratch, no big deal~
You, check to see if Hyacinthus' injury is serious or not.
What? Do it yourself!
You're both female, it's easier that way.
Why are you looking at me like that? I never said that I was...
I-I get it. I'll check her for injuries!
If it's serious, drag her to a doctor even if she says no. I'll take care of the money as well.
Man, he should stop trying to act all cool. If he's concerned, he should show it!
Nigel's always been like that. I'm used to it.
You have a point, though. He's a kinder person than I thought, in his own way.
How about you? Short hair, rugged speech... If you hadn't told me, I'd have thought you were just a slightly girlish guy.
I need to help Nigel take care of the Slums. Acting tough makes things easier.
...Sacrificing yourself to protect Nigel... Changing yourself for him...
...Are you...?
N-No way! It's not like that.
I'm just happy to take on some of Nigel's responsibilities, that's all.
